p: Low concentrations of M. alternifolia essential oil and its main compound (terpinen-4-ol) inhibited the growth of all S. aureus strains tested independently of their origins. In fact, mean inhibitory concentration (MIC) values as low as 0.048–3.125 mg for the whole essential oil, and 0.048–1.52 mg/mL for the terpinen-4-ol are sufficient to inhibit the growth of all S. aureus strains tested. Whereas mean bactericidal concentrations (MBCs) about 25 to 50 mg/mL (whole volatile oil) and 6.25–50 mg/mL (terpinen-4-ol) are needed to completely inhibit the growth of the S. aureus strains tested.
